column2: In this dreary time both in terms of weather and Covid-19 it was a relief to go out for a few hours and virtually forget what’s currently dominating the news. We visited today for lunch and I cannot fault the safety measures, staff friendliness, quality of food and good value. We were there for over two hours and never felt rushed and had such a relaxed meal. According to my husband , the Baked Alaska for two was amazing and could have fed 4 never mind 2! Seriously cannot wait to return as soon as we are able !
Fabulous place to walk. Easy paths down to the wide open beach. Easy to socially distance yourself and no litter whatsoever. Reasonable day rate of £4.50 per car. Highly recommended!

column1: Poor service takes the shine away
column2: Firstly I want to say that the food was excellent and so much better than usual pub food. It was presented beautifully and tasted fresh and full of flavour. There was nothing that I could criticise at all. However the service was extremely poor. We had our dog with us so we’re in the bar area which was no problem at all to us but as we had been put in the rod room it felt that we were just forgotten about. We were there over 2 hours having had just 2 courses. We had to go and find someone to order more drinks, order puddings, get the bill. It really did feel as if we were ‘out of sight, out of mind. The rod room did just feel like a bit of a back office. As I said the food was beautiful but we probably wouldn’t return due to the service.

From the moment you step in you are welcomed like an old friend. Every person says hello whether or not they are waiting on you. The menu is amazing and it was really difficult to choose. I finally settled on the oriental duck spring roll and then the venison. It was truly stunning! I don’t usually have a dessert but found it difficult to say no and had the cherry Bakewell tart. There are absolutely no negatives to this place and I can’t wait to return. The COVID precautions make you feel very safe and are well adhered to as well

We visited recently as part of the Eat out to Help out scheme. We had booked in advance as we knew it could be busy. The staff were helpful explains the way the restaurant works with all the COVID restrictions and we felt perfectly safe. The menu was gorgeous. I had the carrot and apricot chutney tart, my husband had the duo of lamb and my father-in-law had the gammon. The food was amazing and generous portions. We loved it so much we’ve booked to go back again next week!
Gorgeous little deli and cafe. Such a wide range on the menu and cooked and served beautifully. A little gem!

We were attracted to this place due to the constant queue every time we went past. We weren’t disappointed at all. We had the fish cakes with sweet chilli mayonnaise, cous cous and coleslaw. It was divine and very filling. As the weather was good we were fine sitting outside. I can imagine if it’s raining it’s a bit more tricky. Plenty of seating and COVID regulations all adhered to

Very busy when we visited. The car park was totally overwhelmed and people seemed to be parking anywhere. The beach itself was the busiest we visited in the area and although it was beautiful I would choose others (Clachtoll) over this one because of that. It could have been because of all the staycationers due to COVID though. The beach is stunning though and we had a lovely walk across the hills with the dogs

Amazing drive to the beach along a dramatic single track road. We were the only people on this beach for most of the two hours that we were there. The beach is stunning. Crystal clear, turquoise water and fine white sand. We sat and had a picnic by the ricks and the dogs roamed around freely. Truly stunning!
Stunning beach. The car park was very busy when we were there yet the beach itself felt empty. Lovely to walk on crystal white sand and paddle in turquoise water. Totally unspoilt.

Due to COVID the cafe and visitor centre were closed. There was a small takeaway selling drinks and lunches though so that was ok. The actual Falls are viewed from a platform and although it was quiet we still had to wait to watch for salmon. We saw plenty of salmon but felt we couldn’t linger as there were people waiting. Went on the ‘green’ route walk which was pleasant although not very taxing. Overall, a nice place for an hour or so.

The gorge itself is beautiful and an easy path leads you down to the bridge. Only 6 people at a time were allowed on the bridge but this wasn’t a problem as it was very quiet. There was a short walk to the viewing platform which gave views of the gorge from a different angle. However, we had 2 dogs with us and the walkway on to the viewing platform was totally unsuitable. It was made of steel with big holes in it so dogs paws would just fall through. We took in turn seeing the view and the dogs stayed away. We then went for a walk over the other side. We’d been going for about 10 mins when we came across the same type of walkway again and this time there was no alternative or way around. We were so disappointed. This could have been a great dog friendly walk but sadly this let it down totally and given the number of people walking their dogs it must have impacted them as well.

Only a small car park (free) so I’d suggest getting there early. Superb circular walk with a clearly defined route. The walk up to the actual caves is not for the faint hearted though as the path is basically a ledge with a very steep slope on one side. It was particularly windy when we were there so it was a bit hairy ! The scenery is spectacular and the caves really interesting. We took the dogs and they were off lead all the way apart from the climb up to the caves and down. Perfect for a couple of hours.

I visited Ego as part of a large group. The service was second to none. All our meals arrived together so no one was left waiting. The good was fresh and delicious. I had a Greek salad with lemon chicken and I had no complaint whatsoever. The staff were ever so friendly and nothing was too much trouble.
column4: Ego Mediterranean Restaurant and Bar, Stockton Heath

column1: Lovely spur of the moment visit
column2: We rang on the off chance of booking a table and were pleasantly surprised to get one. Lovely atmosphere and the waiting staff were extremely pleasant and polite. Fantastic meal with excellent service. Highly recommend the Monkfish main. We’ll be back very soon!

We had a Valentin’s meal here and overall it was a good experience. There is a varied menu as well as drinks menu. We chose not to have the set menu but the meal that we chose was beautiful. Starters came promptly but then we had to wait for over 45 minutes for our main course. Whilst this wasn’t a problem for us it could be for some. The live music was great and not overly loud. The serving staff were pleasant and helpful despite the restaurant being extremely busy. Overall a really pleasant experience and one that I will repeat in the future.

This was our last night in Reykjavik and I'm so glad we got to try it out. The food was delicious and we chose the bread bowl option with the lamb stew but with free refills of the fish stew as well. Although the surroundings are basic, it was clean and the host was amazing and so funny. Free waffles at the end of the meal was a bonus. Left feeling stuffed and happy!

Our hotel was situated just off Laugavegur and we thoroughly enjoyed strolling up and down this street during the day. There were heaps of quirky shops and bars with things to offer. In the evening it comes alive with the bars and restaurants and can be quite noisy but not overly so.

This is an amazing museum. I'm not one for museums but this one had laid out all the information in such an engaging way that it was hard not to be impressed. There was so much information and the exhibits were extremely well displayed. We spent a good 2 and a half hours here. There were free lockers on the basement floor which meant we didn't have to carry coats and bags around with us. Highly recommended and great for children

What an unusual looking building! Lovely stroll up the hill to get there. Inside, the church is beautiful in its simplicity. We paid to go up the tower which is well worth it for the views you get right over to the mountains in the distance. Great experience especially when the bells chime!

We decided to walk to Perlan from the city centre and it took us about 20 minutes so not too far. When we got there I felt as if there wouldn't be too much to do as it looked quite small but I was pleasantly surprised. The Arora show was amazing and we actually watched it twice. It only lasted about 20 minutes and wasn't busy at all. All the other exhibitions were extremely well done and I learnt so much about Iceland and its history. Great interactive exhibits as well. The coffee shop and viewing level were amazing with fantastic views over all the city. Highly recommended but give yourselves at least 2 and a half hours to browse round.
column4: Wonders of Iceland & Áróra - Northern Lights Planetarium Show

column2: We chose the three course set menu option. One of us had the Icelandic one, the other the french option. It was beautiful and there was nothing that I could fault with the food and there was plenty of it as well. Service was fabulous and nothing was too much trouble. The restaurant was very busy but the service didn't dip at all. The restaurant itself is very cosy and feels quite authentic in its French decor.

Such a welcoming place! Not a huge number of tables but plenty of space so you didn't feel crowded. The menu is small but in my opinion that's better as the food is done very well. Typical Icelandic menu and the waitress explained it very well and helped with our decision. The food was beautiful and we really enjoyed it. In a city where restaurants are very expensive, this was incredibly good value but the quality of the food was excellent! I wouldn't hesitate to go back again!

This was a spur of the moment visit and we decided to go for it after thinking the atmosphere looked inviting. The service was extremely friendly and we were made to feel welcome the minute we stepped in through the door. We both had a burger and they were delicious with generous portion sizes. We shared a dessert which was amazing and would have been too much for one person.

This was our first trip to Iceland and this hotel was one of the reasons we want to go back. Check in was smooth and our room was equipped with everything that we needed. The bathroom was spotless and had a huge shower. As Reykjavik is so expensive it was fabulous to have Happy Hour 4pm to 6pm when there were always plenty of drinks half price and the Grapefruit G and T was delicious. The reception staff were always pleasant and helpful and let us know lots of local tips for trips etc. Great location right in the heart of the city and close to bus stops for travelling to other places.
column4: Canopy by Hilton Reykjavik City Centre

column2: This was our first visit and certainly will not be our last. Everything about this restaurant was first class. Food was fresh, hot and delicious! No negatives whatsoever! We even purchased the wine that we had with our meL from the deli in the way out! The staff are amazing and even had time to chat and explain about the various dishes and wine. My favourite restaurant in Liverpool. If I could give it 6 stars I would!

We chose the tasting menu for 47 euros and were so glad we did. The staff were really knowledgeable of the wines and each course was a spectacle in itself. It felt like a real indulgence eating here. The tables were well spaced and it felt intimate whilst still being busy. There was also the tapas side of the restaurant which was much more informal but was extremely busy. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend to friends!

We went on a recommendation and were so glad we did. We sat at the bar and it was perfect. I definitely think you should book as it was very busy. The menu, whilst not huge, was delicious and there were specials as well. Service was excellent and prices really reasonable. Loved it!

Tired stadium and we weren’t even allowed in the home dressing room. We paid extra for the audio tour and it was confusing and frequently it was difficult to see where we were. Expensive and certainly not worth the money

We visited for dinner when staying at our friend’s house. This is a beautiful pub/restaurant. Our table wasn’t ready when we arrived but no worries as there was a great bar with a huge selection to wait in. Our meal could not be faulted. Everything was super fresh and beautifully presented. The service was second to none. The only reason that I did not give 5 stars was the size of the portion for our main course. Three of us had lemon sole (which was divine) but came with no vegetables other than potatoes. As the portion was already small and at £19.95 I think that this was a let down. Surely some extra vegetables would not have cost much to the kitchen cost? I would certainly return though as the menu was amazing!

One of the things I struggle with when travelling round ancient monuments is the amount of information that you have to read on plinths around the site. Struggling to read them in baking heat and jostling for a good spot to see the writing. Not so at the Panathenaic Stadium. Audio guides were provided within the entrance fee. This was one of my favourite places. There is an amazing atmosphere as you are walking round making you feel as if you’ve stepped back in time. Climbing to the top of the stadium was no mean feat but take it slowly and then enjoy the amazing view from the top. A must visit for an traveller

We visited Erato for lunch and were not disappointed. The seating was comfortable and there was plenty of room between tables. I ordered the pork souvlaki which came with fries and pitta. It was generous in size and there was doubt I wouldn’t go hungry. Plaza has numerous bars and restaurants so it is often difficult to know which is good or not, but Erato would certainly be up there with some of the best. Service was good and pleasant.

Despite a lot of scaffolding due to renovation which I presume will be there for many years to come, it did not detract from the splendour of the Parthenon. It truly is majestic. It was not overly busy and not too hot at this time of year and that really helped us enjoy the history and splendour of this amazing monument.
This is a warren of shops and restaurants which is absolutely beautiful!! I didn’t find it tacky in the least and found it wasn’t overpriced. Loved it!

We travelled in October and this was a perfect time. Not too busy despite a cruise ship being in port at the time and still a pleasant temperature. We chose to pay for The Acropolis and slopes only not the museum. It’s quite a hike up to The Acropolis and I’m not sure how this is manageable if you have a disability. Once up at the top the place is breathtaking. The views are amazing and the work to preserve the ruins is fascinating. A must see in Athens

Having visited this coffee shop on a number of occasions and not been successful in getting a table within half an hour, I was delighted to be successful this time! This is a lovely place! The choice on the menu of both food and drink is impressive. The staff are incredibly helpful and pleasant. I chose a cheese and red onion sandwich and it came with salad, coleslaw and crisps. It was huge and great value for money. There is a choice to sit inside or out and always a chance to glimpse the local alpacas . It genuinely is a pleasure to eat here ( if you can stand the wait!!)

This pub feels totally outdated and in my opinion needs modernising with regards to its decor. It feels stuck in the 80’s. I have been in for just drinks recently and it’s been virtually empty. Not great for your local pub. The emphasis is totally on food
Lovely atmosphere and a wide range of drinks on offer. Love the live music and the decor is pleasant to the eye!

I’ve eaten here twice this week and both times have been a delight! The menu is varied and offers specials which change regularly. The staff are attentive but not overbearing. The fish dishes are always excellent and the portion size is more than generous. A must visit if you’re in the area!

This felt like a lovely indulgence on a hot day in Penang. The food was beautifully presented and tasted divine. There was no shortage of tea and we were well looked after by our waiter. Great value for money and the setting was exquisite.

Loved our visit here. Our taxi driver dropped us off at the top of the hill and we worked our way down. The temples were beautiful and were quiet when we visited. There’s a lot of walking to do so don’t visit in the heat of the day Highly recommended!

We didn’t realise the Dark Cave was closed for renovation when we got there which was disappointing but there was plenty to see otherwise. Note for ladies that unless you have trousers or a maxi dress on you have to hire a scarf to tie round your waist for 2 ringitts. The caves themselves were pretty uninspiring and most people seemed to be concentrating on staying clear of the monkeys who were very persistent and not to be argued with. The climb up was via steep steps and you need to be pretty fit to do this especially in the heat. Worth a visit but not as impressive as I thought it would be .
column4: Batu Caves Tour from Kuala Lumpur

column2: We had a double room and a suite on club level facing The Petronas Towers. I can not fault this hotel at all. The view from the rooms was amazing especially at night. Club level was everything you could have hoped for and we were so well looked after. I wouldn’t hesitate to book this hotel for a return trip and would encourage everyone else to do the same!

We were staying at The Hilton Kuching which was situated right on the waterfront. There is so much to see every night and it’s a buzzing, vibrant atmosphere. It’s very family orientated and attracts plenty of locals with their young children. The water/light show takes place a couple of times every evening and is great to watch. We loved browsing the little stalls especially looking at the ones that sold the local ‘kek lapis’ !

We found this little bar courtesy of Lonely Planet Guide Book and we were so lucky we did! The atmosphere was great and the staff pleasant and helpful. The decor is really quirky and there’s plenty to look at and there’s a great drinks menu to choose from. Highly recommended!

I visited CJ’s for the first time today and it certainly won’t be my last. The atmosphere was so welcoming and you instantly felt at ease. The scones with jam and clotted cream were second to none! I shall certainly be recommending CJ’s to all my friends. Looking forward to a return visit!

Really didn't understand why the first part of this experience was set in a tunnel. Trying to read the information by the light of a small lamp was quite honestly ridiculous! It would have been much more interesting if it had just been a normal sort of museum and I would have been much more willing to linger to read everything. Instead I just wanted to get out! Then we were put through various poses in front of murals on the walls and this went on for over an hour! It was tedious and what started out as being a bit of fun ended with all five of us desperate to get out! Not to be repeated!!

Having seen this as a highlighted restaurant in the Lonely Planet guide book, we were keen to try it out. So glad that we did! It was slightly confusing initially as there just seemed to be a huge crowd of people milling round with no obvious queue. However, the key was to catch the eye of the lady with the clipboard and let her know how many were in your party and she would give you a playing card! Having done this you just sat (if you could get a seat!) and waited until she pointed at you to let you know the table was ready. I don't think that you could go wrong here with any of the choice of dishes, but we ordered a variety of things including the double roasted pork with chilli padi. It was amazing and so cheap. Be prepared to wait for your table but you won't be disappointed.

We would never have found this fabulous little restaurant had we not had the Lonely Planet Guide Book. What a great find! There were five of us and most of us had the duck and it was amazing! My youngest daughter wasn't a fan of duck but there was plenty on the menu to satisfy her as well. The desserts were not to be missed either. This restaurant was as good as any high end place and at a fraction of the price
Very hot and smelly when we were there but well worth a visit! We were bombarded by free samples of durian ice-cream though. Having smelt it I can see why they were trying to give it away!!

We'd heard that queues for the funicular could be horrendous at the weekends so we chose a Monday for our visit and it was around 12pm. We waited less than 10 minutes in the queue at the bottom so did not need to pay extra for the fast pass. The views from the top were spectacular although I struggled with some of the tacky gift shops at the top. We had to wait a little longer to come down about 2 hours later probably about 30 minutes or so. Well worth a visit but time it well!
We had a guided tour of the mansion and it was really easy to understand our guide. It was very informative and the mansion was truly beautiful.

We booked two rooms in this hotel, a suite and a double room both on club level. I really couldn't fault the facilities. The club level staff were exceptional and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were beautiful and very modern. The location of the hotel was perfect and we could walk easily to our destination. I would highly recommend this hotel and club level in particular.

We went on a river night time cruise. Amazing! We saw Irrawaddy dolphins, different types of monkey and when it had gone dark, fireflies that were truly magical! This is an absolute must. We even had food as the sun went down. Great staff and thoroughly knowledgeable about the area. Stunning!
This is a must do! Amazing view of the orang-utans in their natural habitat and we were lucky enough to see a lot of them.

We were lucky enough to meet a 'grab' driver who totally organised this trip for us! We were picked up directly from our hotel and he'd arranged a personal guide to take us round the park. It was extremely hot and humid but our guide was fab and took us on a walk that was challenging but manageable. We saw lots of wildlife that i think we would have missed had we not had the guide. The actual trails were not very well signed in my opinion and I think that there would have been a good chance we would have got lost if we were on our own. At the end of the day we had an extra boat ride that took us all along the coast line, seeing dolphins along the way.

We stayed here as a family of 5, all of us adults. We were lucky enough to be given interconnecting rooms which was a real bonus. We had a suite and a double room. We were staying club level and the staff were very attentive. The hotel is perfectly placed in Kuching right on the waterfront and the views were spectacular. The club level was great for convenience but I felt it lacked atmosphere and the choice of food was somewhat limited. On the odd occasion that we ordered eggs it seemed to take an age to arrive. Overall the hotel is a little tired in places, especially the bathrooms, but I couldn't fault the service.

We loved Gardens by the Bay. We were staying at Marina Bay Sands and had a birds eye view of the night time light show. We did pay to go into the domes and they were amazing! We were lucky enough to be walking on the Skywalk when one of the light shows were on which was really special. Just a warning that if you have bought your tickets for the domes on line and they include the skywalk, you still have to go to the ticket office to get a time to go up. We didn't and had to argue our case for this. Luckily we got to go up
We bought a two day tourist pass and never looked back! Zipped all over the city really easily. Would highly recommend this transport
